Hi everyone, 
it seems this application wont start easely in Windows 7 64 bits (x64). I was stuck at the step 'choose a library'. What Ive done is sipple: 1) I browse my hard disk to reach the program launcher (C:\Program Files (x86)\Britannica 11.0\Ultimate Reference Suite\starter.exe)
2) right click on it's icon, menu option Properties, and after that select Compatibility tab
3) click on box titled 'Run this program in compatibility mode for"
4) Select 'Windows XP (Service Pack 3)
5) start the encyclopedy again,
6) choose a Library
7) You can switch back to Windows 7 by unchecking the compatibility box (step 2 to 4)

it works, regards, Thierry
thanks :)

Please introduce in compressed size

Those who are stuck when installing britannica , try this
1. Search for ''resource1'' rar file among the files within Britannica DVD
2. You can browse the disc and find ''Resource1'' rar file in: BritannicaDVD/installapp/Contents/Resources/Java/ Disc1/InstData/ 
3. Unrar ''Resources1'' to your desktop (only temporarily)
4. When unrarred you wil find $WORKROOT$ folder along with a couple of jar files. Go to: $WORKROOT$/data/cd/shared/fonts, then copy all .ttf files and paste them in C:\Windows\Fonts folder 
5. Restart the installation of the Encyclopaedia (you may be asked to uninstall or delete elements of previous installation)
 6. In my case it solved the problem, hope it does in yours! Enjoy Britannica!
